comments.value:
We have now come to the end of our Volunteering application process. This means that we no longer have a use for the 'Volunteering' preference on our website, since the Volunteers we will be talking to now sit within the ATOS system.

However, we don't want to lose all the people who are on the Volunteering list. Our proposal is to map them across to the Support database i.e. check the 'Support' box for everyone who has checked 'Volunteering'. 

Is this possible and how long will it take? We would need it doing by the end of November.

Thanks!
Marking as high.
NB Please don’t start work on this just yet – need final sign off from internal stakeholder. Will confirm when it’s ready to go!
Please can you advise how soon this can be done once we have sign-off? Would it need to go through staging / CAB?

Hi Morag,

I expect (the moving the users from one list to another bit) won't need to go via CAB as it's not a change that will affect the BT servers directly as it's done in the UMS/CMS.

The changes to the form ie. dropping the 'Volunteering info' box is open to question, I'd say it's more a change CAB just need us to log somewhere, post it happening. Once we deploy the code we're going to test it works and I can't see any possibility of it bringing the server down after we have confirmed it works, if in the worse case scenario a bug did get in then we'd obviously roll back the change immediately. Therefore the impact on BT is zero and the impact on the rest of the business is similar to an editorial change that has been checked.

As I understand it the rational for CAB is so that:

i) Should a problem arise with the servers BT/IPSOFT/ITS (or the help desk) can look back and see what has changed and therefore decide whether an incident may be affected by a recent change. This really makes most sense in terms of server configuration changes (something we have been increasingly reluctant to do for a while now, for exactly these reason) and not content, markup or template changes.

ii) CAB can decide that it's not a good idea for a change to be made in case it clashes with (for example) a political sensitive date/event or another significant change due to happen round that time (ie. a change to the network).

In terms of timescale I'm passing that bit over to Kieran to answer.

Although I would expect we'd be able to get it done this month.

Jamie

Thanks for this response. I agree with your view on CRs - and think this is supported by the info I sent round yesterday re: what merits a CR vs just a Servicedesk ticket. 

Just for clarity on our requirements - we want to be able to give Volunteers a flag in the Supporters box, but we also want to be able to keep the Volunteers field and data live within the UMS (though not on the sign-up form), so that we can see going forwards which of our supporters had also expressed an interest in being a Volunteer. We are aiming to send an email to Supporters who had expressed interest in volunteering, which means we need to be able to see who is in both lists. 

Re: timescale we would actually want to bring this forward earlier if possible - could it be done this week at all?

Hi Morag, I'm embarking on this right now.
I estimate one day of development, plus 0.5 days deploymeny, but it might take longer as there are about 160,000 users that need modifying.
Am currently testing on our test server.
Great – thank you. Estimate sounds fine – please proceed

Hi Morag,
Not sure whether you'll agree, but I think that when an existing user, who is already subscribed to the "Volunteering" mailing list returns to the site, he SHOULD see the "Volunteering" checkbox (otherwise there's no way for him to unsubscribe).
New users, and existing users who are NOT subscribed to the "Volunteering" mailing list should NOT see the checkbox.
Does this make sense?

Actually, we won’t be using the Volunteering list again to mail people.

We are merging the volunteers into Supporters, and will use that list to mail them from going forwards.

So neither existing nor new users should see the Volunteering checkbox.

Ah, ok. I was under the impression that you wanted to keep the Volunteering mailing list (perhaps for some legacy reason).
Ok. That makes it clearer then.
I'll just delete all the Volunteering subscriptions, and give them a "Support" subscription (if they haven't already got one).
Yikes, that's not what we want! We need to keep the fact that they were volunteers so we can filter by them - but we don't need to give them the option to unsubscribe.. Please don't delete data!

Right. Glad we got that one clarified!
I have this all ready to go now.
I will either do it this evening or tomorrow morning.
Here is what I will do:

1. The "Volunteering" mailing list will become hidden. Members of it will still be searchable via the UMS, but no-one can join or leave it. It will not appear on the register, or edit-profile pages.

2. All members of the "Volunteering" mailing list who are not already subscribed to "Supporters newsletter" will be subscribed to it.

I hope this is correct.
If not .... let me know.

Kieran

spent most of today looking at this.
implementing tomorrow morning.

Sounds great - thanks.

In terms of how this affects Communicator and our mailing lists there, can you ensure there continues to be a mailing list on Communicator? We will want to be able to access that for reference and to extract data (not to send from it tho).

Hi Kieran

Has this now been done?

Morag

Hi Morag,
It's not a simple switch-flicking operation.
It will be done in ~1hr.
Kieran

Hi Morag,
The website now reflects this change.
There is still some updating going on in the CMS which should be complete
within about 20 mins or so.
Kieran

Complete.
Tested on dev, and - after deployment - on live site.

☺ Sorry, I always come across as if it’s you getting ready to pull a big lever ... which I realise it’s not.

Morag

comments.value:
I have just realized that our short urls seem to be case sensitive.  Surely that can be fixed?  Obviously most people write urls with lowercase, but it's still a bit of an issue...

So :  london2012.com/Shop doesn't work.  Nor does http://www.london2012.com/TechnologyInternships (we just created /technologyinternships)

Liz Goulding
Senior New Media Producer
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games
Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297
Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000
www.london2012.com
www.twitter.com/london2012

What the hell is *anyone* using case sensitive url's for ??

It like people who have insist of having a case sensitive email addresses and send emails to every website they register on [quoting RFC 5322] and bemoaning the fact that their email address doesn't get accepted / email isn't delivered to them. Surely life would be easier if you just changed your email address???

OK sorry, deep breath, rant over ;-)

(I was/am semi joking above)

The design of that tool was to allow very basic short strings to pint to urls ie. /technology /volunteer.

It also doesn't allow non alphanumeric characters, although I think the only thing stopping you using upper case is the reg-ex we use, so we can obviously change it.

In the immediate term / for the case below I can add an extra case sensitive redirect rule manually (I'm guessing a print publication or email has been sent out?)

But going forward do you *really* want to allow case sensitive short urls? Surely we should be discouraging the use of them? 

Sorry if this response is a bit ranty, I just really think this allowing camel case in short urls a terrible idea and just going to lead to issues/confusion.

I will add a link in for TechnologyInternships now though.

No no – the whole point is that we DONT want case sensitive urls. I want /Shop and /shop to go to the same place, but just to protect users who happen to type /Shop from getting a page not found. In the short term we’ve set up an extra one for TechnologyInternships to point to the same page (that was the one that caused the issue), but I’d rather that we get something sorted out where that happened automatically!

Hi Liz,

Genuine question is the requirement that we catch mis-spelt or mis-cased urls or is that that marketing actually want to use the CamelCase versions?

One though is for us to to use mod_speling this is an Apache module that best guesses mis-spelt urls, not 100% sure if it will work with redirects (just checking)
http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.0/mod/mod_speling.html

Legally (ie. according the the RFC) /TechnologyInternships is a different from /technologyinternships so we need to be careful about completely ignoring case, although I can't think of a single case we're we differentiate pages or assets on case alone (and if we did we are insane and need to fix it) so it may just be a case of getting Apache to ignore case. 

Investigating..

Jamie

See my follow up email, the danger is you end up with short urls for all permutations, I guess what you want is the urls (short urls in particular) to be handled by Apache case insensitive?

btw. if any potential *Technology* Intern takes the url www.london2012.com/technologyinternships decides to CamelCase it and then wonders why no page is found and can't figure out to try the lower case version then that probably a pretty good basis for ruling them out. Might but down the number of potential useless applicants. Or was the url actually sent out in CameCase?

Just stepping back and thinking is the solution to allow CAPS in short urls or is it that we need to make Apache case insensitive (and does that have any issues).

Hi Liz,

OK solution !

We're going to change the redirect rules written out by the short url tool so that urls are case incentive ie. you'll only type in /shop (but /shop /Shop /SHOP will all work.

We're just checking this doesn't have any SEO issues, as they are permanent redirects it should be fine.

Jamie

Liz, is your requirement simply that "shorturls" be made case-insensitive?
If so, then we can do this fairly simply.
In total it would be about 1/2 day.
After this change, a short url of:
  /technologyinternships
would catch any case-variant. E.g.
  /TechnologyInternships
  /TECHNOLOGYINTERNSHIPS
etc.

As Jamie suggests, any attempt to implement a site-wide strategy for catching users' typos would be a /lot/ more complicated (but I don't think that's what you're asking for, is it?)
That was all very confusing – but sounds like a good solution! I will check on the SEO side of things too and hopefully we’ll both come up with the same answer!

No, we don’t need to catch for typos.

All we want is that a short url would catch the case variants of all caps and camel case, as you’ve indicated!

Providing, of course that there aren’t any SEO issues!
Quicker than your average conference call though ;-)

1) Have added in a temporary rule for tech interns (done)
http://www.london2012.com/TeChNoLoGyInternShipS

2) Going forward if you want this to happen automatically (as per K's comment) we need to modify the short url tool to handle writing out and reading in the redirect urls in a case insensitive fashion.

Let us know if/when you'd like us to get started on 2) above [as it's a permanent redirect I can't see any SEO issues]

Jamie

1) Excellent

2) My main question is – what would happen if after we set up /technologyinternships we either changed or wanted to delete it? Would all the other derivations get removed, too?

> 2) My main question is – what would happen if after we set up 
> /technologyinternships we either changed or wanted to delete it?
> Would all the other derivations get removed, too? 

Yes.
Can I consider this ticket authorised (at up to 1/2 day)?
Thanks,
Kieran
Yes, it’s authorized to start investigating implications! Let me know before you start building anything!

Liz, just to confirm, we don't envisage any SEO issues.
Remember that Google will rarely see these shorturls, and that we always serve a permanent redirect.
Even in the unlikely case that all of the following occur:

  1) Hundreds of other sites link to the /technologyinternships shorturl
  2) These sites - for some reason - link to many different case-permutations (e.g. /TechnologyInternships, /TECHnologyInternships, etc.)
  3) Google cares about differences in url case (which we're almost certain it doesn't)

we still serve a "permanent" redirect which shouldn't have any negative SEO implications.

Case-insensitive shorturl-matching is for a perfectly valid reason - to help people who see an ad on a billboard, or in the newspaper, but can't remember the exact case when they finally get to their computer - and so is very unlikely to cause any issues with Google / other search engines.

(Time thus far: 0.2 - to implement the change will be 0.6 in total - that's including 0.1 for jamie to investigate & fix the existing shorturl. Please let me know if you'd like to proceed - NB we won't promote this change during the deployment freeze!)
Liz, can you authorize 0.6 days for this? Many thanks.
I just want to check with our SEO agency – give me a day or two and then chase again!
Reset to high and pending. Hoping for go ahead before Monday if possible.
I’m failing on this – sorry! I will try and confirm ASAP
Liz, any chance of an update on this?
I’ve heard back – they’re looking into it. Hoping to give full details soon! Sorry. :-/
Right. 301 redirects to the all lower case versions!

Hmm, if I understand you correctly, the requirement is that if you type in:
  1. http://www.london2012.com/TechnologyInternships
then we first serve a 301 redirect to:
  2. http://www.london2012.com/technologyinternships
which - in turn - gets served a 301 redirect to:
  3. http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/jobs/working-for-locog/locog-technology-internship-programme/index.php

We can - of course - do the above. However, it is more complicated than our original proposal.

I'm not trying to persuade you either way - I'm just double-checking - do you really want two redirects to be served in these cases?

(NB If you type in the all-lowercase version then only steps 2 & 3 will occur - i.e. only one redirect will be served).
Ah – see the complication. Let me check again!
This is more complex than it seems – I’m having a meeting with them next week...
Hi Liz. Is this meeting still taking place this week?

I wonder whether it might be worth someone from Kitsite having a chat with your SEO advisors?
The reason I ask, is that I would be astonished if the short urls being made case-insensitive made any difference at all to the site's search ranking, so I'm wondering whether they misunderstand what is being proposed.
Additionally, we are quite keen to know whether to enable or disable this new functionality before we do a CMS deployment.
One or two ad-hoc case-insensitive redirects are already in place (having been specifically requested) so we've had to amend the short url editor. However it would be useful to know whether future urls should be case-sensitive, so we can set the "default" behaviour.
Thanks,
Kieran

Hi Kieran,

I gave Danny an update on this, but I agree that it's all a bit confusing. As for some reason it doesn't seem to be recorded here ... this is what they've advised us:
(for example): /TechnologyInternships should be 'autogenerated' when /technologyinternships is raised, but it should point directly to the full address and not via /technologyinternships

Does that make sense? And I definitely understand that it could be a lot of (not necessary) work -- it could be easier to just manually add in a few specific ones...

I'm happy to set up a call with the SEO guys, though, if you would find it helpful!
________________________________________

Ok, well ... it looks to me as if they're saying that:
 TechnologyInternships
should redirect directly to:
 get-involved/jobs/working-for-locog/locog-technology-internship-programme/index.php

i.e. without any kind of "intermediate" redirect. i.e. they DON'T want multiple redirects to occur. i.e. they DON'T want:
 TechnologyInternships
to redirect to:
 technologyinternships
which - in turn - redirects to
 get-involved/jobs/working-for-locog/locog-technology-internship-programme/index.php

If I've understood their requirement correctly then ... we meet it, to the letter. This is exactly what has been implemented for the TechnologyInternships redirect, and for future ones (if we - Kitsite - press a switch).

Does this make sense? Or do you think I should have a chat with them?

That's definitely what they meant - how long would it take you to implement that automatically? I just don't want to waste too much time on it...
________________________________________

In order to implement this functionality, the total cost will be 0.8.
(By the way, the time already spent on this ticket is 0.6).

So .2 more! That sounds reasonable. :-P

Can you tell me exactly how it will work?

As I indicated before, MOST of the work had to be done anyway, in order to accommodate the ad-hoc ones that have been requested.
See attached for how it will operate.
Awesome. Go ahead and finish off the last .2 days, but please don’t deploy to live. I need to figure out if a change request needs to be raised for it.

As far as I'm aware, a change-request is only necessary for code which is being deployed to the live webservers.

This new functionality is in the CMS.

Obviously IF you tick the case-sensitive box then a case-insensitive redirect will get published to the live webserver BUT we have already proved that concept (i.e. there are already such redirects on the live webservers).

However ... it's obviously not my call!

Although the new checkbox does make a change to what gets written to the redirects file and a change to the that file is potentially disruptive. If little changes to obscure parts of the site need to be controlled then maybe this will need to be too.

True. We should arguably, also, validate the .htaccess file.
I'm just going to check whether it's possible to update it with nonsense...

Turns out it is - well ... more to the point, it WAS.
We now dbl-check that the shorturl and the target contain "safe" characters.

Hi,

We've noticed that some photo pages that are carrying the correct tags (e.g. Northern Ireland) aren't appearing on the correct pages.  Could you please investigate?

e.g. http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/pages/editform/photos/2010/11/the-chess-piece-performed-by-echo-echo-70889.php isn't appearing on http://www.london2012.com/about-us/the-people-delivering-the-games/the-nations-and-regions-group/northern-ireland.php

Liz Goulding
Senior New Media Producer
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games
Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297
Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000
www.london2012.com
www.twitter.com/london2012

I think this may have been to do with the pages carrying tags that weren’t capitalized! That is, the location had been ‘northern ireland’ on the page and ‘Northern Ireland’ on the photo page. I didn’t think case sensitivity would have mattered??

Hi Liz,
It does make a difference, as we presume that the metadata fields have been filled from the taxonomy values - i.e. selected via the autocomplete, Apart from ease-of-use, this is another reason why the autocomplete functionality is there.
Would you like me to investigate how many other locations there are that have been entered in, in incorrect case?
Kieran
PS Well diagnosed, by the way! That's exactly what I was investigating myself, but you beat me to a conclusion!
Thank you! Nah, let’s not worry about it. I’ve fixed it for those pages now, and will just need to remind people to be sure they select from the autocomplete in future!

comments.value: The due date is provisional. Original spec attached.
If there are some comments about the current version, I'm happy to distill a to-do list from that one and known issues.

Missing parts according to the original spec:

1.1 mobile detection
1.3 navigation menu - to be adjusted to javascript-less devices
1.5 colour pink not applied yet - is it still a requirement?
1.5 - 1.6 prev/next navigation links are a bit flaky, need to be fixed
1.9 about pages: as per spec, needs bespoke content + sponsor logos
2.2 footer: to be added
I will follow up with Morag and Liz on Friday. Morag: if you can chase content and logos for about pages it would be very helpful.

Copying in my last email to Morag:

Hello,

I've done some more work on the mobile site and believe it's very
close now. Nb some older pages might look funny as they need to be
republished.

> - logo is pixellated and seems to default to Paralympic logo only - it
> doesn't animate and the Olympic logo doesn't appear. Is that due to the
> Javascript not working?
Logo got bigger and changes with every page load now (previously it
only changed with every publish ie. every hour)

Also looked at the logo (R)s in the cms - turns out the only logo that
has a proper size (R) next to it is the flash one. Jamie asked to
provide us with the correct assets, it's in progress.

> - clicking Contents button at top takes you out to main london2012.com
> and out of mobile site
This is where lack of javascript doesn't and this design collide a
bit. Here's what I've done:
- if the user doesn't have javascript, navigation is on the bottom and
hitting the contents button rolls to the bottom of the page (ie to the
navigation)
- if the user has javascript, the navigation is on the bottom on the
page initially
- if the user hits the contents button, it turns into a pull-down menu
(and disappears from the bottom)

So it progressively enhances as the device gets smarter. Also,
homepage headers are now clickable and bring to the correct section of
the site.


> - the angled header bars are rendering with jagged edges
I'm not entirely sure what you mean, but adjusted the headers so that
they behave better.


> - indenting on the blog is not quite right - some stories are indented,
> others not
Do you have an example for this?

> - some code is displaying in the news story 'London 2012 Young Leaders
> programme launches'
I believe it must have been a content issue and got resolved.

> - Our terms is missing in the Blackberry version, as is Full site view
It's in the navigation - so now you'll find a link at the bottom of the page.

> - News archive - you say there is an archive in the Javascript menu, but
> if the Javascript is switched off, how will this work? Do you mean you
> can't access the archive on a Blackberry?
We can now with the bottom navigation.

> - About us content - I will prepare and send through asap
Great, do let me know if there's any update on that.

> - Links to other pages outside the mobile site - this is my biggest
> concern. When you say about not giving people the opportunity to link
> through, do you mean you will disable links and remove blue link
> styling? I am happy to do this if we can make it work seamlessly, but
> this will be difficult e.g. with news stories which have the sentence
> 'View the media release'.
I'm afraid I haven't really thought about the vast amount of content
we have and resolving this would vastly extend the scope. What we
quickly can do for javascript enabled browsers is when they click on a
link that's not on the mobile site, we tell them that they leave the
site.

> - Samsung handsets: Omnia or Omnia 2 are the handsets we want to
> optimise for if possible.
Note taken - again, it would be -crucial- to have an actual device to
work on the small details. Omnia and Omnia 2 have much more advanced
browsers than blackberries, but they still can have some
peculiarities.
We may want to reset the due date on this. It's been in a pending state for several weeks.
We have agreed a budget of 0.5 days to review the current state of the mobile site and recommend changes to existing site to make it fit for launch.
starting assessment...

I've had a look around. The general assessment that this is almost ready to go live. There are three relatively minor (.5-1 day) tasks:

1. Links to the normal site + external links
Some news articles and blogs link to the normal website and external sites. We discussed pop-up alerts, but I reckon we've since found a very reasonable solution for external links: the little icon next to the link we're currently using on the normal site. I suggest to make it a bit more sophisticated:
 - internal links (that point to another mobile page) just act like as normal links
 - external links work like on the standard homepage: they get an external link icon and open in new tab/window
 - internal london2012.com links that point to a desktop page get a different icon and open in a new tab
This would make 'risky' links more obvious and we could help the user stay on the mobile website.

2. Prev / Next links on news and mobile pages
This is a bit confusing: on the mobile page, we have 'prev' and 'next' buttons under every news and blog article. This is something we don't have on the desktop site. The problem is they are prone to break due to publication issues. Two options here:
- Get rid of 'next' / 'prev' buttons altogether (we don't take away a lot from functionality, but will be less confusing)
- Make 'next' / 'prev' pages work (with php file check) - this sounds a bit time consuming and has a small risk of running away

3. london2012.com => london2012.com/mobile redirect when visited with mobile devices.
This has two parts:
- m.london2012.com should redirect to london2012.com/mobile
- if someone enters www.london2012.com with a mobile device, redirect to london2012.com/mobile

Sorry for delay in responding to this. My thoughts:


1. Happy to adopt this – which icon were you thinking of using?

2. Happy to get rid of ‘next’ and ‘previous’ buttons

3. Agreed

Please proceed, with a view to pushing live asap.

Many thanks

Morag
Good news. Janos, please proceed with this when you are ready.
Getting on with this then.

Morag,
1. The original symbol is 
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/images/icons/link-external.gif
and the new for links to 2012 pages on the normal sites are this at the moment:
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/images/icons/link-external-internal.gif
it's not genius, but one can differentiate between the two. If you go to the preview, you can see it in action:
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/mobile/index.php

2. I've removed the prev and next links for news&blogs - we're going to need a publish to make it go live.

3. And now I'm going to Kieran with the redirects.

1. Yes, happy with that

2. Great

3. Excellent – please let me know when it’s done so we can check it out
Kieran says the redirect is a perfect opportunity to have a play with the staging server. Otherwise it's ready to go live relatively easily.
Go for it

comments.value:
We'd like to be able to distinguish between user generated and 
our own uploaded photos within CMS

It not very generic but is there anyway we can distinguish a image with uploadedBy / let 2012 filter by them obv. billable work (although imagine a day is the absolute most they would pay for it). Is this something Janos could look at.

This needs to be a bit more tightly specified. Filtered where? In the global navigation, in the pictures filter menu, in the picker? How can they be distinguished anyway, ie what is the Finder filter criterion?

Hi,  can someone please clarify where we are with this?  I know that they are being identified, sort of, on the front end as user-generated b/c of the way they appear on the photo hub page (see attached).  But then the user information is missing on the photo page itself.  Is there a way to include that, somehow?

Also,  i think to answer Michael's question - what was requested is so once we've published a user photo, we could have some way of figuring out which photos are user-generated.  right now it just says that the owner is delstein, b/c she published it. the only way to tell is b/c we've tagged it 'user upload' and that we can see what folder it lives in (/useruploads).  It would be nice if it were a filter or something, so when we have more user photos, they don't 'clutter' the main picture view.

does that make more sense?
Erm, a filter where? Do you mean http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/files/pictures/ ?
Liz says: "Yeah, i think that's what we mean. So in the 'pictures' page in the CMS we want a 'filter' to show only those photos that are user generated. I think."
Set to high.

In the "Pictures" screen it would be difficult - and no doubt unusably unperformant - to filter on "uploadedByDisplayName" as this metadata is held on the photo page, not the image asset. However, the image's owner is set to the external user who submitted it. Would it suffice to display their email address in the screen or tooltip? 

I don't understand Liz's comment that "the user information is missing on the photo page itself" - isn't this what uploadedBy and uploadedByDisplayName are for? Or does she mean on the live site - if so, a separate issue should be opened for that unrelated task.

It would be really helpful if I had a better idea of what the *problem* is that we're trying to resolve here. What is the use case? What task(s) are 2012 staff finding it difficult to perform, and why? Might need to resort to the "5 whys" technique here :)

I believe I meant on the live site - there were two points to this 
1) editors ability to distinguish between ugc and our photos
1a) in the 'uploaded photos' area, there is no way to see the username of the person who sent the pic in?
2) the public to be able to distinguish between ugc and our photos. There is the 'your recently uploaded phtoos' box, but then on the photo page you lose the ability to see who it was posted by!

One-by-one:

1. Editors ability to distinguish between UGC and our photos.

I suggest the following two enhancements (and apologies for the slightly crude quality of the image mock-ups!)

i) Amend the picture editor to allow an extra filter to be specified. See "Pictures-with.png".

ii) Amend the image-picker, to allow a similar filter to be specified. See "Picket-without.png" and "Picker-with.png".

(These filters will include/exclude the "user uploads" section).

Estimate: 2/3 - 1 day.
Go for it!

1. Editors ability to distinguish between UGC and our photos. 

This is completed on dev, ready for deployment.

Time: 0.7 days (plus a one-off deployment when all of these items are deployed)

2. the public to be able to distinguish between ugc and our photos. There is the 'your recently uploaded phtoos' box, but then on the photo page you lose the ability to see who it was posted by! 

Can you check the following page, and see whether it looks ok please?
  http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/photos/user-photos/music-producer.php
In particular, note:
	Music Producer
	Uploaded by Jayanta Pathak
	13 Jul 2010

Does this look ok?

Hi Kieran,

We need the Uploaded by to show their username, not their full name!

That would be a big step in the right direction. Once we’ve got this we can turn to figuring out searching/filtering UGC only photos.

"Jayanta" is that fellow's first name, which is what we use in the absence of a "username" (by which I think you mean "displayName").
  http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/photos/user-photos/music-producer.php
Another example is:
  http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/photos/user-photos/coupe-d-europe-d-athletisme-d-annecy.php (first name "jamel")

Splendid. That’s fine! Just make sure we never display the surname.

Otherwise, I’m happy with this!

(2.) Has now upped time to 0.8.

Will shortly discuss 1a)

Liz> 1a) in the 'uploaded photos' area, there is no way to see the username of the person who sent the pic in?
Thanks. This is not now high priority, let’s focus on other stuff first.

haven't really got to grips with any of these things (are Kitsite bored or did you just shout at them?) - could we have a quick meeting to sum up changes sometime this week?! am now going to delete all postcms emails without trying to get my head around them : )

Subject: Travel Advice to Businesses functionality
Importance: High

Hello there

You are already working on the Travel Advice to Businesses pages for london2012.com to get them live for late November.

There is a second piece of work by M&C Saatchi we are considering for implementing in January - an interactive tool which would walk users through a series of questions and then allow them to download a personalised 'travel plan' based on their responses. An outline of this process is attached, together with wireframes.

We have been told that the interactivity is client side (JavaScript and php). We would wish these pages to be built in the CMS so content can be managed.

What we need from you by Friday morning is a sense of:
Is this achievable in our CMS?
Is there anything M&C are proposing which you don't like or believe to be advisable?
How much time will this take you to implement and what is the cost?
What would you require from M&C Saatchi to smooth this process (more information, coding)?

Grateful for your thoughts.

Many thanks

Morag
